version_a.description: Fixed version with cached price and minimum update interval to prevent flash loan oracle manipulation

ground_truth.root_cause: Oracle returns spot price calculated from current Curve pool balances. Flash loans can manipulate pool balances within a single transaction to inflate/deflate reported prices.
ground_truth.attack_vector: Flash loan to imbalance Curve pool, oracle reports manipulated price, borrow against inflated collateral or liquidate positions at deflated values, rebalance pool, profit.

differential_details.changes_description_a: Added cachedPrice and lastUpdate state variables, MIN_UPDATE_INTERVAL constant (1 hour), getAssetPrice returns cached price if update interval not met, separate updatePrice function for price updates.
differential_details.changes_description_b: getAssetPrice calculates and returns spot price directly from current pool balances.

exact_changes.version_a: function updatePrice() external { require(block.timestamp >= lastUpdate + MIN_UPDATE_INTERVAL, "Too soon"); ... }

differential_details.why_this_matters: Cached price with time delay prevents flash loan manipulation by ensuring price updates require time to pass, making same-block manipulation impossible.
